name: Mount Ascutney

trails_config.name: Windsor Trail
trails_config.description: A classic monadnock hike passing Gerry's Falls. The summit observation tower offers a commanding view of the Connecticut River Valley.

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of Vermont on Mount Ascutney. At 3144 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3144 feet, Mount Ascutney is a standout peak in Vermont. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Windsor Trail**, a **5.4 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
